reviews.review_msg: So passionate about her work so she's expressive whilst explaining. Sometimes her concepts can be confusing as in she thinks we are also as passionate as she is so she talks to us like we are already at a certain level. Tutorials are great, pray you get a good TA and you'll ace the essays and final.

Michael is one of the best professors I have ever had. You can see his passion for English and the material in his lectures, and he hooks you to what he is saying everytime. His humour and caring nature helps you stay engaged and there is not too much work for the course other than readings.

Everton is an amazing professor who made me fall back in love with English! His assigned readings and lectures are engaging and he genuinely wants everyone to learn and succeed in his class. Tutorials are discussion-based (attendance marked) and useful for understanding the complex novels. Show up and put in the effort and you will do well!

Paul is god sent. As someone who hates history, I was nervous to take an English focused on the past. Paul made everything EXTREMELY clear and I always left his lectures confident in what we were taught. He is funny too and definitely easy on the eyes

Paul Budra is excellent! I highly recommend him. I took English 211 with him and had a fabulous experience. Budra is the God of Renaissance/Early Modern literature, absolutely knowledgeable. Also, he always responds to emails super quickly. Take his class if you want a stress-free English class to enjoy the beauty of literature.

Do you want a prof you can never please? Who gets upset if you use classroom material in your essay? Well look no further than JD Fleming. No matter how much effort or thought you put into your work it will never be enough. Feedback? Vague Grading? Inconsistent. If you want a class where you walk away confused or frustrated this is the one for you

Lectures can be a bit rambling but once he finds his rhythm they can be really amazing. Funny and seems kind enough. He places an emphasis on creating unique ideas and pieces of writing. Definitely have to work do well, but everything is done fairly.

Lectures were excellent and enjoyable. Readings were hard, but he explains them in depth. Funny and kind. No marks for participation. Only midterm paper, term paper, and final exam. The final was open-book with devices.
